title: Yeah, this app doesn’t work
text:
I thought the other reviews were exaggerating the lack of care Samsung put into this app (and perhaps Smart Control feature, overall). I tried to set it up with the Flexi Washer/Dryer combo. The app crashes instantly at the end of account creation. It at least created the account — you will know it, too, as you have to manually enter your password when you start the app. 

Now, I’ve read that you have to also manually enable Smart Control every time you use your washer, which doesn’t sound too “smart.” Unfortunately, I may never be able to try it myself. Despite latest tech and powerful router and signal strength (yes, tried 2.4Ghz and older OS, too), I can’t get the app to connect to the server. I can enable AP search (hold the lower Smart Control Button while the machines are on), find the network, connect the devices... and the it’ll simply never complete the server connection at the very end and times out. 

Given that each machine has two Smart Control buttons, you’d figure Samsung would spend a little more time on getting this stuff to work. Disappointing.

title: Only slightly helpful
text:
I have the Flex Washer/Dryer combo and I love them. But I’ll be honest, when I bought them, the WiFi capabilities influenced me exactly 0%. I just couldn’t understand why I would ever need to start my washer remotely. I mean, I still had to sort and load the clothes myself and I still had to add the soap and fabric softener. So what was the point? Then I was leaving the house to go visit a friend for the weekend and wondered if I had remembered to start the dryer. I was already on the road, so I couldn’t check. The answer, of course, was that I hadn’t and my clothes smelled awful when I got home and I had to rewash them all. That’s when I realized the usefulness of the WiFi feature. 

All this to say, the app doesn’t work very well. It only works if the machines are turned on and there’s no way to remotely turn them on and they will turn off automatically after a period of time. Then on top of it, I can’t get the “smart control” to work. It keeps saying something is wrong with my router connection even when I’m standing right next to it. 

The only thing I can do, if the machines are on, is see how much time is left until the load is done. Not overly helpful.

title: Replaced by SmartThings (Samsung Connect) app
text:
Chances are if you’re reading through these reviews, you’re not doing it because you want to see how everybody else thinks this app is terrible and gloat at what the awful product development team at Samsung has done with it. My guess is you’re probably looking at these reviews for the same reason I did; to find out how to get it working.  The short answer is, you won’t — but read on:

The vast majority of Samsung devices that this app was meant to support have quietly been added (over time) in the newish SmartThings app.

Why Samsung didn’t advertise this, or put a note in this app’s description that it’s been deprecated and most devices are now supported in SmartThings? I don’t know… but check out that app; it will probably be the solution to your woes today. If your device isn’t supported now, it will likely be in the future — they add new devices on a monthly basis.

If this was helpful, you might mark my review is helpful so that other people can get this information instead of seeing the loads of complaints people have about this particular app. Not but those aren’t valid, but I wish I had found this information a lot sooner.

In summary, LOVE Samsung appliances. They should probably try to hire some people from Apple to completely revamp their Smart Home division and actually make it technically match the companies other qualities.

First, it's complicated, with multiple steps and instructions seemingly designed by IKEA. We have it for a new fridge. To get it set up, you have to do something on the phone, and then on the fridge, and then on the phone, and again on the phone, and finally on the fridge and phone, simultaneously.

Finally, every step seems to work, once you figure out their bizarre instructions - every step except for the last one. So far, we've had no success in making that one work. It shows it's trying to connect for about ten minutes, and then gives instructions to start over.

And so, you start over. And it doesn't work again. Totally frustrating - a complete waste of time.

title: Horrific
text: I work for Pacific Sales and one of the most expensive refrigerators that we sell is the Samsung units with the giant touch screen family hub. Really big issue considering the majority of people that shop here also use iPhones.  Good luck with this fridge if you don't fix he issues and make it accessible to your demographic.

title: Almost useless
text:
